The Help About window should close in response to a control-W from the keyboard.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Help/About...
2.Control-W
Actual Results:  
Help window stays open.

Expected Results:  
Help window closes.

comments.text:
Obviously, we cannot expect users to tell apart fancy dialogues (like Help > About) from fancy windows. Moreover, there's ux-consistency problem because Alt+F4 works to close About dialogue, suggesting that it is a window. So I don't see a reason against having Ctrl+W as an alternative shortcut to make the behaviour consistent with other types of TB windows.

If there are no duplicates, this should be confirmed.
